intro: Maesa efatensis, commonly known as the Efaté Mountain Maesa, is a shrub native to the island of Efate in Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
